item.title: More Films
item.description:
I’ve been adding to my films lists. World history topics are so big! There are a ton of entries for Industrialization, Imperialism and the Great War, the three pages most recently added. As I have noted in the top corner of each film page, please keep in mind that these films have not been sorted apart from designation as either documentary or feature presentation. I plan to do this in time, but I feel that for now it is most important that I get each page populated with initial content before I go back and thin out selections and such. For the moment, please browse and read the descriptions to see if a film is worth your time.

item.title: Podcast Addition Coming Soon
item.description:
The whole podcast project I am going to attempt is, like this site, meant to illuminate the basic events of modern world history.

Topics will be covered in a thematic-chronological blend, starting with a very quick overview of the foundations of the modern world including religious, philosophical and civic ideas. Following that I will examine the Atlantic Revolutions of the late 18th and early 19th centuries, Industrialization, European Imperialism, Modern Ideologies, the Great War, the Interwar Period, World War II, the Cold War, the Holocaust and other Genocides, and Globalization.

The plan is to create introductions to each of these topics, and then cycle back through with more in-depth lectures, so although the breadth of this podcast stays the same, the depth will increase over time.

Additionally, I will try to post materials related to each podcast here on the site. You can find the related materials through links on each Podcast description, the Blog, the Site Guide, the Topics page, and of course the Search. If you know of a resource that would be helpful, please let me know.

item.title: The Holocaust
item.description:
The Holocaust may be the event that most clearly separated the twentieth century from the ones that came before it: it relied on racial ideology, industrialization, and totalitarian control in a way previous events of mass murder had not. I have put together a page of links to help with the understanding and teaching of the critical history, as well as other related pages listed below.

item.title: Iraq’s Ethnic Cleansing
item.description:
Ethnic Cleansing in Iraq refers here to two separate events, which will be organized better later. The first is the Al-Anfal Campaign by Saddam Hussein regime against the Kurdish people in the North of Iraq, and the second is the unmixing of ethnic and religious groups under American occupation between 2003 and 2009. I have put together some pages to start gathering information here:
Ethnic Cleansing in Iraq
Links Regarding Ethnic Cleansing in Iraq
Bibliography of Ethnic Cleansing in Iraq
Films Dealing with Genocide in Iraq

item.title: Democide in the U.S.S.R.
item.description:
Politicide in the U.S.S.R. on this site (so far) refers to both the famine of 1932-33, known in the Ukraine as Holodomor, and the Great Purge between 1936 and 1938. The famine was caused by government policies of collectivization, and death estimates range up to 11 million. The Purges were political repression in the form of show trials, police surveillance, dekulakization, labor camp imprisonment and executions. I put the following pages together on the subject:
Politicide in the U.S.S.R.
Links Regarding Politicide in the U.S.S.R.

item.title: Armenian Genocide
item.description:
The Armenian Genocide refers to massacres and forced deportations of about one to one and a half million Christian Armenians living in Turkey under Ottoman Rule. It occurred during the first world war, and war helped to justify the violence as well as keep the world from involving itself in the crisis. Attacks were also directed against Assyrians and Greeks, though this is less widely known.

I have put up pages to begin gathering information here: Armenian Genocide, Links Regarding the Armenian Genocide, Films Dealing with the Armenian Genocide, and Bibliography of the Armenian Genocide.
